awd_titl_txt: PRC Supplement: Stability of Flow Between Rotating EccentricCylinders
awd_abstract_narration: The main thrust of this proposal is to study the flow between rotating          eccentric cylinders.  It is expected that the results will contribute to        a better understanding of the operating conditions of journal bearings          working around the transitional point.  Current experimental and                theoretical knowledge of flow between eccentric rotating cylinders is           limited, and a numerical study, as proposed, is probably the right way          to go at this point.  Especially if the various operating parameters,           i.e. Reynolds number, radius ratio, eccentricity, non-isothermal                behavior, temperature dependent viscosity, end-wall effects, etc., are          to be investigated with an ultimate goal of determining better design           criteria.  The approach proposed here is mathematically sophisticated,          but practical, well-thoughtout, and appropriate for the task at hand.           Support is recommended.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: UNIVERSITY OF PITTSBURGH - OF THE COMMONWEALTH SYSTEM OF HIGHER EDUCATION
